dt: {bc}a device or product that provides assistance

et: Middle English {it}assistent,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}assistant, assistent,{/it} noun derivative of {it}assistant, assistent,{/it} adjective, "assisting, helpful," from present participle of {it}assister{/it} "to help, aid" {ma}{mat|assist:1|}{/ma}
In the case of both this word and {et_link|assistance|assistance} Modern English has chosen the French form with {it}-a-{/it} in the suffix rather than Latin {it}-e-.{/it}
shortdef: a person who assists someone : helper; also : a person holding an assistantship
a device or product that provides assistance

dt: {bc}a person certified to provide basic medical services usually under the supervision of a licensed physician

shortdef: a person certified to provide basic medical services usually under the supervision of a licensed physician —called also PA, physician's assistant

dt: {bc}a person certified to provide basic medical services usually under the supervision of a licensed physician

shortdef: a person certified to provide basic medical services usually under the supervision of a licensed physician —called also PA, physician assistant
